<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="120">
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(1)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Mr.&nbsp;Corcoran's
change-in-control agreement provides for a lump sum cash payment in the amount of three times his "annual compensation,"
as described at page&nbsp;122, if within three years following a change-in-control, our successor terminates his employment without cause or Mr.&nbsp;Corcoran terminates
his employment for good reason. In addition, his agreement contains provision that prohibits him from soliciting our employees, contractors or consultants to join one of our competitors, which would
apply for one-year after termination of his employment. The amount shown in Column B </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>130</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=133,EFW="2185889",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="1",CHK=62412,FOLIO='130',FILE='DISK131:[08ZBU1.08ZBU10601]EM10601A.;12',USER='DCONRAD',CD='21-MAY-2008;23:13' -->
<A NAME="page_em10601_1_131"> </A>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>represents
payments we would have made under our new executive severance plan assuming it had been effective at December&nbsp;31, 2007. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(2)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>The
value of stock option vesting reflected in the table is zero as none of the unvested options has an exercise price less than the $13.61 closing price of our stock
on December&nbsp;31, 2007.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(3)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>The
value of restricted stock vesting was calculated by multiplying the number of unvested shares by $13.61, with any performance measures through the end of 2007
factored into the calculation for Death or Disability but not for a Change-in-Control.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(4)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>This
reflects the anticipated payout rate for performance share awards with uncompleted performance cycles as of December&nbsp;31, 2007.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(5)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Mr.&nbsp;Corcoran
was 0% vested in his SERP benefit as of the end of 2007. This amount represents the portion of Mr.&nbsp;Corcoran's SERP benefit that would become
non-forfeitable upon his death or permanent disability. There is no incremental value to Mr.&nbsp;Corcoran in other termination situations.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(6)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Mr.&nbsp;Corcoran's
change-in-control agreement provides that if any Company payments made upon termination after a
change-in-control of the Company constitute a "parachute payment" under Section&nbsp;280G of the Code, the Company would make a gross-up payment to
Mr.&nbsp;Corcoran. The gross-up payment would be equal to the amount necessary to cause the net amount retained by Mr.&nbsp;Corcoran, after subtracting (i)&nbsp;the parachute payment
excise tax imposed by Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code, and (ii)&nbsp;any federal, state and local income taxes, FICA tax, and the Section&nbsp;4999 excise tax on the gross-up payment,
to be equal to the net amount Mr.&nbsp;Corcoran would have retained had no Section&nbsp;4999 excise tax been imposed and no Company gross-up payment been made.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(7)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>In
addition to the total values payable to Mr.&nbsp;Corcoran upon each of the triggering events contained in this table, Mr.&nbsp;Corcoran would have been entitled
to receive or retain the following amounts, none of which would have increased or accelerated on his termination or a change-in-control of the Company: (i)&nbsp;all of his
vested stock options reported at page&nbsp;108, unless he is terminated for cause; (ii)&nbsp;his accrued benefits under our nonqualified deferred compensation plans, as reported at
page&nbsp;118, unless in the case of the SERP he is terminated for cause; (iii)&nbsp;his accrued benefits under the WaMu Pension Plan, as reported at page&nbsp;114 and his accrued benefits under
the ETRIP, as reported in footnote 3 to the Pension Benefits Table at page&nbsp;114, in each case unless he is terminated for cause; (iv)&nbsp;his 2007 Leadership Bonus Plan cash bonus payout; and
(v)&nbsp;his accrued benefits or amounts under Company plans that do not discriminate in favor of executive officers and that are available generally to all salaried employees, such as the WaMu
Savings (401(k)) Plan. As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, the aggregate of these amounts was $389,742, or $9,146 if Mr.&nbsp;Corcoran had been terminated for cause.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(8)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>These
columns assume that the vesting of stock options and restricted stock accelerated on the consummation of the change-in-control because the
Human Resources Committee did not provide for the assumption of unvested stock options and restricted stock by the acquiring company.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(9)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Note:
For a change-in-control and subsequent termination of Mr.&nbsp;Corcoran's employment, he would have received the "Total Value Upon
Event" specified in the table in column C plus the "Total Value Upon Event" in either column D or column E, depending upon the circumstances of his termination. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>131</FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=134,EFW="2185889",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="1",CHK=253853,FOLIO='131',FILE='DISK131:[08ZBU1.08ZBU10601]EM10601A.;12',USER='DCONRAD',CD='21-MAY-2008;23:13' -->

<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="120">
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(1)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Mr.&nbsp;Cathcart's
change in control agreement provides for a lump sum cash payment in the amount of three times his "annual compensation," as described at
page&nbsp;122, if within three years following a change-in-control, our successor terminates his employment without cause or Mr.&nbsp;Cathcart terminates his employment for
good reason. In addition, his agreement contains provision that prohibits him from soliciting our employees, contractors or consultants to join one of our competitors, which would apply for
one-year after termination of his employment. The amount shown in Column B represents payments we would have made under our new executive severance plan assuming it had been effective at
December&nbsp;31, 2007.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(2)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>The
value of stock option vesting reflected in the table is zero as none of the unvested options has an exercise price that is less than the $13.61 closing price of our
stock on December&nbsp;31, 2007.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(3)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>The
value of restricted stock vesting was calculated by multiplying the number of unvested shares by $13.61, with any performance measures through the end of 2007
factored into the calculation for Death or Disability but not for a Change-in-Control.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(4)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>This
reflects the anticipated payout rate for performance share awards with uncompleted performance cycles as of December&nbsp;31, 2007.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(5)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Mr.&nbsp;Cathcart
was 25% vested in his SERP benefit as of the end of 2007. This amount represents the portion of Mr.&nbsp;Cathcart's SERP benefit that would become
non-forfeitable upon his death or permanent disability. There is no incremental value to Mr.&nbsp;Cathcart in other termination situations.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(6)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Mr.&nbsp;Cathcart's
change in control agreement provides that if any Company payments made upon termination after a change-in-control of the
Company constitute a "parachute payment" under Section&nbsp;280G of the Code, the Company would make a gross-up payment to Mr.&nbsp;Cathcart. The gross-up payment would be
equal to the amount necessary to cause the net amount retained by Mr.&nbsp;Cathcart, after subtracting (i)&nbsp;the parachute payment excise tax imposed by Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code, and
(ii)&nbsp;any federal, state and local income taxes, FICA tax, and the Section&nbsp;4999 excise tax on the gross-up payment, to be equal to the net amount Mr.&nbsp;Cathcart would
have retained had no Section&nbsp;4999 excise tax been imposed and no Company gross-up payment been made.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(7)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>In
addition to the total values payable to Mr.&nbsp;Cathcart upon each of the triggering events contained in this table, Mr.&nbsp;Cathcart would have been entitled
to receive or retain the following amounts, none of which would have increased or accelerated on his termination or a change-in-control of the Company: (i)&nbsp;all of his
vested stock options reported at page&nbsp;108, unless he is terminated for cause; (ii)&nbsp;his accrued benefits under our nonqualified deferred compensation plans, </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>132</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=135,EFW="2185889",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="1",CHK=17927,FOLIO='132',FILE='DISK131:[08ZBU1.08ZBU10601]EO10601A.;7',USER='DCONRAD',CD='21-MAY-2008;23:14' -->
<A NAME="page_eo10601_1_133"> </A>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>as
reported at page&nbsp;118, unless in the case of the SERP he is terminated for cause; (iii)&nbsp;his accrued benefits under the WaMu Pension Plan, as reported at page&nbsp;114 and his accrued
benefits under the ETRIP, as reported in footnote 3 to the Pension Benefits Table at page&nbsp;114, in each case unless he is terminated for cause; (iv)&nbsp;his 2007 Leadership Bonus Plan cash
bonus payout; and (v)&nbsp;his accrued benefits or amounts under Company plans that do not discriminate in favor of executive officers and that are available generally to all salaried employees,
such as the WaMu Savings (401(k)) Plan. As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, the aggregate of these amounts was $340,895, or $9,450 if Mr.&nbsp;Cathcart had been terminated for cause. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(8)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>These
two columns assume that the vesting of stock options and restricted stock accelerated on the consummation of the change-in-control because
the Human Resources Committee did not provide for the assumption of unvested stock options and restricted stock by the acquiring company.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(9)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Note:
For a change-in-control and subsequent termination of Mr.&nbsp;Cathcart's employment, he would have received the "Total Value Upon
Event" specified in the table in column C plus the "Total Value Upon Event" in either column D or column E, depending upon the circumstances of his termination. </FONT></DD></DL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B><I><U>Fay L. Chapman</U>  </I></B></FONT></P>

<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="32%" ALIGN="LEFT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT><BR></TH>
<TH WIDTH="2%" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>

<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="120">
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(1)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>Amounts
shown represent $531,000 in base salary through June&nbsp;30, 2008 under the terms of Ms.&nbsp;Chapman's severance agreement and $2,650,000 in consulting
fees payable under her consulting agreement to be effective July&nbsp;1, 2008. For purposes of cash severance, "cause" for Ms.&nbsp;Chapman means a material breach by her of the terms of her
severance agreement, and "good reason" means a material breach by us of the terms of her severance agreement.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(2)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>The
value of stock option vesting reflected in the table is zero as none of the unvested options has an exercise price that is less than the $13.61 closing price of our
stock on December&nbsp;31, 2007.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(3)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>The
value of restricted stock vesting was calculated by multiplying the number of unvested shares by $13.61, with any performance measures through the end of 2007
factored into the calculation for Death or Disability but not for a Change-in-Control.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(4)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>This
reflects the anticipated payout rate for performance share awards with uncompleted performance cycles as of December&nbsp;31, 2007.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(5)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>In
addition to the total values payable to Ms.&nbsp;Chapman upon each of the triggering events contained in this table, Ms.&nbsp;Chapman would have been entitled to
receive or retain the following amounts, none of which would have increased or accelerated on her termination or a change-in-control of the Company: (i)&nbsp;all of her
vested stock options reported at page&nbsp;108, unless she is terminated for cause; (ii)&nbsp;her accrued benefits under our nonqualified deferred compensation plans, as reported at
page&nbsp;118, unless in the case of the SERP and SERAP she is terminated for cause; (iii)&nbsp;her accrued benefits </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>133</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=136,EFW="2185889",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="1",CHK=553190,FOLIO='133',FILE='DISK131:[08ZBU1.08ZBU10601]EO10601A.;7',USER='DCONRAD',CD='21-MAY-2008;23:14' -->
<A NAME="page_eo10601_1_134"> </A>
<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>under
the WaMu Pension Plan, as reported at page&nbsp;114, and unless she is terminated for cause, her accrued benefits under the ETRIP, as reported in footnote 3 to the Pension Benefits Table at
page&nbsp;114; (iv)&nbsp;her 2007 Leadership Bonus Plan cash bonus payout; and (v)&nbsp;her accrued benefits or amounts under Company plans that do not discriminate in favor of executive
officers and that are available generally to all salaried employees, such as the WaMu Savings (401(k)) Plan. As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, the aggregate of these amounts was $4,293,215, or
$2,077,318 if Ms.&nbsp;Chapman had been terminated for cause. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(6)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1>These
columns assume that the vesting of stock options and restricted stock accelerated on the consummation of the change-in-control because the
Human Resources Committee did not provide for the assumption of unvested stock options and restricted stock by the acquiring company.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-9pt;'><FONT SIZE=1><SUP>(7)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=1><I>Note</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=1>:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For a change-in-control and subsequent termination of Ms.&nbsp;Chapman's
employment, she would have received the "Total Value Upon Event" specified in the table in column C plus the "Total Value Upon Event" in either column D or column E, depending upon the circumstances
of her termination. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>134</FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=137,EFW="2185889",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="1",CHK=283813,FOLIO='134',FILE='DISK131:[08ZBU1.08ZBU10601]EO10601A.;7',USER='DCONRAD',CD='21-MAY-2008;23:14' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_eq10601_1_135"> </A>


<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"Black" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:times;" -->


 </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>Compensation of Non-Employee Directors  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Board of Directors, acting upon a recommendation from the Governance Committee, annually determines the non-employee directors' compensation for
serving on the Board and its committees. In establishing non-employee director compensation, the Board and the Governance Committee are guided by the following goals: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Compensation
should consist of a combination of cash and equity awards that are designed to pay the directors fairly for work required for a company of our size and scope;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Compensation
should align the directors' interests with the long-term interests of shareholders; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Compensation
should assist with attracting and retaining qualified directors. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
making its recommendation, the Governance Committee considers information received from Towers Perrin, the compensation consulting firm, regarding competitive information on outside
director compensation for </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Fortune 500</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> companies generally and for the peer banks we use to benchmark executive compensation, as discussed at
page&nbsp;86. Towers Perrin also provides recommendations for our non-employee director compensation program. The chair of the Governance Committee engages Towers Perrin to perform the
analysis provided to the Committee. The Governance Committee and Board most recently completed this process in December 2007, and determined that our director compensation for 2008 should change
slightly from 2007, as noted below. We do not pay director compensation to directors who are also our employees. The elements of compensation paid to non-employee directors for their
service on our Board are described below. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Cash Compensation  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Non-employee directors receive the following cash payments for their service on our Board of Directors and Board committees: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>an
annual cash retainer of $60,000;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>$750
for attendance at each purely telephonic Board meeting or committee meeting;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>$1,500
for attendance in person or by telephone at each other Board meeting or committee meeting;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>an
annual retainer of $10,000 to the chair of each of the Finance, Human Resources and Governance Committees;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>an
annual retainer of $7,500 to the chair of the Corporate Relations Committee;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>an
annual retainer of $20,000 to the chair of the Audit Committee (increased from $15,000 in 2007); and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>an
annual retainer of $25,000 for the Lead Independent Director (increased from $5,000 in 2007). </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each
Corporate Development Committee member other than Mr.&nbsp;Killinger receives an annual cash retainer of $6,000 in lieu of any fees for committee meeting attendance. </FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Directors
who resign or retire from our Board receive a prorated portion of the applicable cash retainers based upon their service on the Board and Board committees during the year.
During 2007, we did not provide perquisites to any director in an amount that is reportable under applicable SEC rules and regulations. We directly pay or reimburse all non-employee
directors for parking, travel and accommodation expenses in connection with attendance at Board and committee meetings. When a </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>135</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P style='font-family:times;page-break-before:always'></p>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=138,EFW="2185889",CP="WASHINGTON MUTUAL, INC",DN="1",CHK=411767,FOLIO='135',FILE='DISK131:[08ZBU1.08ZBU10601]EQ10601A.;7',USER='DCONRAD',CD='21-MAY-2008;23:14' -->
<A NAME="page_eq10601_1_136"> </A>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>director
retires from our Board, it is our practice to make a $10,000 cash donation in the retiring director's name to a charitable entity selected by the director. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Stock Compensation  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each non-employee director is eligible for an annual grant of options to purchase Company common stock and shares of restricted stock issued from our
Amended and Restated 2003 Equity Incentive Plan, as recommended by our Governance Committee. The options and restricted stock we award to our directors vest on the first anniversary of the date of
grant, subject to earlier vesting on termination of service in certain circumstances. Shares of restricted stock for directors accrue regularly-declared Company dividends in the form of additional
shares of restricted stock. </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B> Deferred Compensation  </B></FONT></P>

</UL>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our directors are also eligible to participate in our Deferred Compensation Plan, which is described in greater detail at page&nbsp;119. The Deferred
Compensation Plan allows eligible directors to defer their vested restricted stock and their fees and retainers payable for their service on the Board and Board committees. </FONT></P>


<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Director Compensation in 2007  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The table below shows compensation we paid our non-employee directors for 2007. Mr.&nbsp;Chazen is not included because he joined our Board in 2008. </FONT></P>

column reflects the dollar amount recognized for financial statement reporting purposes for 2007 in accordance with FAS&nbsp;123R for awards of unvested
restricted stock. The fair value of Company restricted stock is based on the market value of our common stock on the applicable measurement date for accounting purposes. For additional information,
see Note&nbsp;21 to the Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc. and Subsidiaries Consolidated Financial Statements contained in the Company's Form&nbsp;10-K for the year-ended
December&nbsp;31, 2007. As of December&nbsp;31, 2007, each non-employee director held the following number of shares of unvested restricted stock (including dividend shares) issued as
stock awards: Mrs.&nbsp;Farrell: 3,452, Mr.&nbsp;Frank: 3,451, Mr.&nbsp;Leppert: 1,678, </FONT></DD></DL>

<TABLE WIDTH="77%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" WIDTH="120">
<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><SUP>(4)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>The
amount shown for Mr.&nbsp;Frank represents above-market interest on his vested balance in an unfunded deferred compensation plan for certain former directors of
Great Western Financial Corporation, for which we assumed responsibility as successor to Great Western. No additional compensation may be deferred under this plan. Interest accrues on fund balances
outstanding within the plan at enhanced rates. In accordance with applicable SEC regulations, the reported above-market interest consists of earnings to the extent the interest rate exceeded 120% of
the applicable federal long-term rate (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>Benchmark Rate</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"). Mr.&nbsp;Frank's enhanced rate for 2007 was 6.31%, which exceeded the
Benchmark Rate of 6.27%.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2><SUP>(5)</SUP></FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>For
Mr.&nbsp;Frank, this column includes certain retirement benefits to which he is entitled under an unfunded directors' retirement plan for which our Company assumed
responsibility as successor to Great Western Financial Corporation. Upon termination of service on Great Western's board of directors, each eligible director became entitled under the plan to an
annual retirement benefit equal to the sum of the annual retainer previously paid to members of the Great Western board plus 12 times the monthly meeting fee, both as in effect at the time of the
director's termination. Benefits are payable for a period equal to the number of years that the eligible director served as a Great Western director and will be provided to the surviving spouse or
other designated beneficiary following an eligible director's death. Pursuant to the plan, Mr.&nbsp;Frank is entitled to receive quarterly payments of $11,650. Mr.&nbsp;Frank is entitled to
receive these payments until October 2008. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>137</FONT></P>

<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#08ZBU10601_2">QuickLinks</A></FONT>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"Black" -->




<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"font-family:times;" -->


 </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ks10601_exhibit_31.1"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ks10601_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 31.1    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>CERTIFICATION  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>I,
Kerry K. Killinger, certify that: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K/A of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc.;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report. </FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="50%" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Date: May 22, 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="47%" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>KERRY K. KILLINGER</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> Kerry K. Killinger<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Chairman and Chief Executive
Officer<BR>
of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc.</I></FONT></TD>
</TR>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ku10601_exhibit_31.2"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ku10601_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>EXHIBIT 31.2    <BR>    </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2><B>CERTIFICATION  </B></FONT></P>

<P style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>I,
Thomas W. Casey, certify that: </FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>I
have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K/A of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc.;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='font-family:times;margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD style="font-family:times;"><FONT SIZE=2>Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report. </FONT></DD></DL>
<BR>

of Washington Mutual,&nbsp;Inc.</I></FONT></TD>
